dmca.title: [ABUSE] stolen content
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Summer [mailto:jhs@mail.tentonweb.com] 
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2006 1:30 PM
To: Legal Response
Subject: RE: FW: [ABUSE] stolen content

OK... Is this what I am supposed to look for? From your
www.theplanet.com/legal page...

Prohibited Content

Customers shall not allow the posting, transmission, or storage of data and
content on or through the Services which, in The Planet's sole
determination, constitutes a violation of any relevant law, regulation,
ordinance, or court order. Customers shall be responsible for determining
what laws or regulations are applicable to their use of the Services.

Copying and pasting my home page content is definitely "a violation of any
relevant law..."

If you are not going to do anything about this person you host please tell
me rather than sending me links and/or cryptic messages. I don't want to
waste your time I would appreciate that courtesy as well.

Thank you,
Jim Summer




---------- Original Message ----------------------------------
From: "Legal Response" <legal-response2@theplanet.com>
Date: Thu, 16 Mar 2006 10:15:01 -0600

> Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jim Summer [mailto:jhs@mail.tentonweb.com]
>Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2006 5:05 PM
>To: Legal Response
>Subject: Re: FW: [ABUSE] stolen content
>
>So what does this mean? Is there a particular format I need to use to 
>file a formal complaint?
>Thank you,
>Jim Summer
>
>---------- Original Message ----------------------------------
>From: "Legal Response" <legal-response2@theplanet.com>
>Date: Wed, 15 Mar 2006 16:03:00 -0600
>
>> To Whom It May Concern:
>>
>>Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does 
>>not substantially comply with the required notification elements of 
>>the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>>
>>Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
>claim.
>>
>>Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
>> 
>>Legal Response Team
>>THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com]
>>Sent: Wednesday, March 15, 2006 10:23 AM
>>To: copyright@theplanet.com
>>Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] stolen content
>>
>>This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Tuesday, March 14,
>>2006 at
>>22:08:49 and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated 
>>to your team. The message and headers follow.
>>
>>Thank you,
>>
>>Policy Enforcement
>>The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
>>http://www.theplanet.com/legal/
>>
>>SUBJECT:
>>[ABUSE] stolen content
>>
>>MESSAGE BODY:
>>Hello ThePlanet.com,
>>A site you host;
>>http://www.designirvana.com/
>> 
>>has copied and pasted huge chunks of my home page into their spammy 
>>site in what looks like a lame attempt at gaming Google's adwords and 
>>Amazon as well. This spammy SEO tactic kills my traffic that I earned 
>>by hard work. It has suddenly become apparent why an IP address 
>>belonging to you keeps scraping my site... to get my content I worked 
>>hard at perfecting for the search engines.
>> 
>>Go here;
>>http://www.designirvana.com/DesignSchool/web-design-classes.html
>> 
>>search for Jim Summer... my name is in his page and my content verbatim...
>>almost my entire home page is on this clown's page. This is the only 
>>page I am aware of. I am sure there are many as this type of slimy 
>>tactic knows no ethics.
>> 
>>This is copyright infringement and a violation of the Digital 
>>Milennium Copyright act.
>>Please remove this site http://www.designirvana.com/.
>> 
>>Thank you,
>>
>>Jim Summer
>>Web Design & Development
>>Search Engine Optimization
>>508 Compliance
>>904.221.4196 \\ home
>>AIM \\ TenTonJim
>> <mailto:jhs@tentonweb.com> jhs@tentonweb.com  <http://tentonweb.com/> 
>>TenTonWeb.com
>>Visibility-Speed-Compliance-Usability:  <http://www.tentonweb.com/> 
>>www.tentonweb.com
>>
>> 
>>
>> 
>>
>>
>>RFC822 HEADERS:
>>Received: from localhost ([127.0.0.1] helo=[216.185.111.52])
>>        by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from
>>abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com)
>>        with esmtp (Exim)
>>        id 1FJNJL-0002gz-AC; Tue, 14 Mar 2006 22:08:35 -0600
>>Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180]
>>        helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com)
>>        by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from jhs@tentonweb.com)
>>        with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 
>>1FJNJJ-0002gl-7q
>>        for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 14 Mar 2006 22:08:33 -0600
>>Received: from mail13.atl.registeredsite.com ([216.247.37.27])
>>        by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jhs@tentonweb.com)
>>        with esmtp (Exim) id 1FJNJH-0006KO-DC
>>        for abuse@theplanet.com; Tue, 14 Mar 2006 22:08:32 -0600
>>Received: from mail.tentonweb.com (mail.tentonweb.com [64.224.249.81])

>>-0500
>>From: "Jim" <jhs@tentonweb.com>
